Business Systems Advisor

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Job description

We are currently seeking an experienced Business Systems Advisor for the West Gate Tunnel Project

About CPBJH JV

CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.

The West Gate Tunnel is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. The Joint Venture has been chosen as the preferred contractor for construction, which began in early 2018 following planning assessment.

About The Project

The West Gate Tunnel Project is a city-shaping project that will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include:
  • Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road;
  • Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville;
  • Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge;
  • Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne; and
  • Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.

Business Systems Advisor

To assist in the management and implementation of all systems, technologies and applications on the Project, ensuring alignment with statutory and contractual compliance.

Position Responsibilities
  • Provide advice to Project employees on internal plans and systems. Assist with implementation of and training on systems and processes. Keep up to date records of users and super users. Facilitate ICT support to the Project.
  • Assist in completing compliance statements to the appropriate standard in a timely manner.
  • Provide ongoing training to wider Project team on current and new systems being implemented. Keep records of training delivered and training materials.
  • Maintain key working relationships with Executive Leadership Team and the Wider Project Team


Qualifications
  • Relevant tertiary education in Business, Management, ICT or similar.


Experience
  • Experience in project delivery systems such as: requirements management, safety, quality and environment assurance, systems engineering and assurance and/or risk management.
  • Systems Engineering background and experience in the following systems would be advantageous but not essential:
    • IBM Rational DOORS V9.0
    • IBM Rational DOORS Next Generation
    • ComplyPro
    • Aconex
    • Aconex Field
    • SharePoint
    • Power BI

CPBJH JV is committed to equal employment opportunity (EEO) and actively seeks to remove barriers people may face in gaining a successful position on the West Gate Tunnel Project. We value diversity in our team and people who share our values of authenticity, respect and excellence are encouraged to apply.

About The Role

There’s no other communications company in Australia that has the range of opportunities on offer like at Telstra! We are a company that shapes the world of tomorrow through technology, join the team and further your career in more ways than you can imagine.

Telstra’s Cyber Security Operations team’s mission is to protect the privacy and security of our customers, Telstra and the services we provide, and to play a leading role in shaping the cyber security landscape.

We're working hard to become a world-class technology & service organisation and are looking for a committed Cyber Defence Manager to lead and build Telstra’s Cyber Security Defence capability, enable the defence of Telstra, its people, customers and its assets from successful cyber-attack as well as effectively manage its people to provide the optimal coverage for Telstra.

Responsibilities

Your daily key responsibilities and major tasks include, but not limited to

As the Cyber Defence Manager, you will drive improvements in cyber security capability, ensure appropriate response to customer and internal security incidents. It will give you an opportunity to demonstrate your cyber tradecraft to the Cyber Defence staff to pass on the skills you have learned in previous roles. 872659139:
[

Client Solutions Manager

Company Name News Corp Australia Company Location Southbank, VIC

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 74 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who we are

We are news. We are sport. We are lifestyle. We are News Corp Australia.

The nation's most influential media organisation, News Corp Australia reaches an unduplicated audience of 16 million Australians every month. As well as our famous news and sports brands, we lead the way in fashion, food, health, real estate and parenting. We have the largest online news audience in the country, with a bigger digital footprint than Facebook.



What's the role?

Reporting to a Client Solutions Director and supported by a Client Solutions Specialist, you'll be the first port of call across our Victorian Sales teams for any client solution need across our regional mastheads. This will include interpreting client and agency media briefs, tailoring national insights and trade marketing strategies and proposing strategic sales solutions across multiple platforms which ultimately suit the needs of our clients. You'll be required to generate blue sky ideas that 'wow' our clients and put together competitive packages which our sales team can successfully take to market.

Within this Client Solutions Manager role, you'll be responsible for developing a solid sales pipeline and have an intimate understanding on opportunities in market and how our regional publications can remain top of mind for our Victorian Sales teams. You will conduct market, competitor, media and environmental analyses to stay abreast of any trends that may impact the business. Layered within sales responsibilities, this role will also have extensive stakeholder management responsibilities and accountability to multiple stakeholders across News' regional publications wider News Corp team.



Who you are

You're a commercially astute and customer-centric professional who has a track record of success in an integrated media environment, preferably agency or publisher side. You'll possess a thorough understanding of the media landscape and your digital capability will be second to none. You will have a fresh and dynamic approach to driving client strategies through cross-platform integration, thus working knowledge of various media platforms is essential. Your ability to quickly turnaround insightful proposals and confidently present them to both internal stakeholders and key clients is paramount to the success of this role.

You'll understand what is required to ensure our client solutions are targeted and integrated at a scale which is unmatched in the regional market. Your experience building relationships with clients has attributed to your previous sales success. You're a natural collaborator who is used to operating in a strategic, inclusive and creative manner. You'll have an excellent eye for spotting commercial opportunities and you're passionate about emerging media and identifying market trends.



What's next?

This is a permanent full-time role based at our Southbank office. There's an on-site gym, coffee on tap, and plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby to keep your work/life balance healthy. We are offering a competitive package in addition to a fun, fast-paced working environment and excellent opportunities for growth and development. To apply or find out more about careers with us, see newscorpaustralia.com/careers.

About us:

At Hostplus, we passionately provide our one million members with the best possible service; constantly looking for new ways to deliver better value while helping them get the most out of their super. We are inspired to help our members achieve greater security for their future and ensure they retire with dignity.

The role:

A rare opportunity to join our Claims team, we are currently seeking multiple Insurance Relationship Coordinators to manage a portfolio of claims and provide superior service to Hostplus members, claimants and third-party representatives.

As an experienced professional, you will have a high level of resilience and empathy when handling inbound claim enquiries, you will provide support and guidance to members and will be able to work effectively and efficiently to resolve sensitive and complex claims while managing your daily workflow.

Your experience and knowledge in end to end case management of TPD, TI, IP or Death claims and having a thorough understanding of superannuation, insurance and relevant legislations will be key to success in this role.

  • Ensure all members are proactively communicated with and educated throughout the process
  • Assess claims and make recommendations to the trustee
  • Monitoring and managing respective insurers and ensuring claims are progressing in accordance with service level agreements
  • Working closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure outcomes are delivered efficiently
  • Preparing “Declined Claims” for the Claims Review Committee
  • Processing payments in line with best practice standards
  • Identifying and implementing process improvement and changes

  • Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of life insurance claims and insurance administration processes
  • Demonstrated case management experience
  • A proactive service focus with the ability to build and manage relationships

  • Excellent writing and verbal skills especially in articulating complex information in a way that is easy for claimants to understand

Why work at Hostplus:

Our employees are passionate about what we do and are proud to be part of an organisation which helps everyday Australians achieve a brighter future. Some great benefits we offer:
  • 15% superannuation
  • Access to internal financial planning services
  • Flexible salary packaging
  • Excellent EBA conditions, including company-provided annual Christmas leave, extended parental leave and qualification for long service leave at 5 years.

If this is what you’re seeking, apply now to be considered.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Teacher

Company Name Goodstart Early Learning Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Teacher – Melbourne

Goodstart is Australia’s largest early learning provider. As a not–for–profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families. Our people are our foundation, together we are working to ensure children have the learning, development and wellbeing outcomes they need for school and life.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic Teacher to develop programs and practices that are responsive to our children’s needs and aligned with the Early Years Learning Framework and National Quality Standard.

You will be part of our supportive culture and have access to a qualified mentor to support your professional development and growth.

Goodstart Early Learning Child Care Centre Melbourne Central is located in the heart of the CBD and is easily accessible by public transport. We are close to everything – schools, shops, transport, and often Mum and Dad’s work, making the daily drop-off and pick-up far less stressful!

Our rooms – from Nursery to Kindergarten / Preschool – are set up and regularly changed in line with the Early Years Learning Framework curriculum and we work closely with parents and families to ensure the needs, interests and strengths of each child is taken into account.

Our Storypark platform is central to our ability to maintain clear and open lines of communication between the centre and our families. Any new developments, milestones or even issues which might arise from time to time can be communicated to families and plans put in place.

Outside, we have a wonderful large space – and all of it, aside from our garden area is undercover. That means whatever the weather our children can explore and enjoy the fun of playing outdoors. We have a sandpit, bike path, wooden decking and a performance area, as well as a vege patch and other garden spaces. Children can let their imaginations run free all in the name of sensory and play-based learning.

Your role
  • Hold a Bachelor of Early Childhood or equivalent qualification (ACECQA approved)
  • Hold a current First Aid qualification
  • Work in a purpose built, well resourced centre
  • 80 place centre with 5 rooms
  • Role is based in a 32 place 3 to 6 year room
  • Centre is offering a set middle shift
  • Centre has incursions and excursions in place
  • Plan innovative and engaging learning experiences
  • Champion positive and meaningful relationships with children
  • Full time, permanent role commencing immediately


Responsibilities
  • Assess children’s learning and development and apply pedagogical expertise to inform curriculum decisions
  • Maintain and apply expert knowledge of the National Quality Framework
  • Seek and share best practice examples to improve the education program
  • Build and maintain strong, positive relationships with families, children and the centre team
  • Model effective application of pedagogy in teaching practice
  • Contribute to a professional and positive work culture


The Benefits
  • Comprehensive induction and training programme
  • Access to a professional peer teacher mentor
  • Professional pedagogical and operational centre support teams to assist you in providing high quality educational programs.
  • Competitive above award wages
  • Quality teaching and Educational resources
  • Professional development and networking
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • Discounted child care fees
  • Uniform allowance

If you have a Bachelor of Early Childhood Education or ACECQA approved equivalent qualification, and experience in a similar role, then we want to meet you!

Goodstart is committed to child safety, with a zero tolerance of child abuse, and expect all our employees to reflect this commitment. Should you strive to uphold and reflect these values then we would love to hear from you!

To apply for the role please ‘Apply Now’ or to review the role PD please

For further information please contact David Pytko on 03 9825 7715

Job description

Neptune has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Dive Technician to join our diving team. Reporting to the Melbourne Base Manager, this role is responsible for undertaking maintenance and servicing of dive systems and associated equipment, ensuring the workshop is technically equipped at all times. The Dive Technician will also assist the Melbourne Base Manager in facility maintenance activities and other workshop tasks.
\xa0
There is opportunity for this role to work on local inshore dive projects in the Melbourne metropolitan area as well as work on offshore projects in Australia and overseas.
\xa0
This role will be offered on an initial 12-month fixed term contract.

Key responsibilities:
  • Assist with pre-mobilisation and post-demobilisation activities for projects as required
  • Ensure project readiness of all assets and associated equipment prior to mobilisation
  • Ensure appropriate compliance and certification of assets and equipment prior to packing and transportation to the project, including requirements for customs, quarantine and security
  • Maintain knowledge of diving assets and equipment and plan changes
  • Assist with controlling costs associated with assets and equipment through effective forecasting and management of maintenance and certification schedules
  • Perform servicing and maintenance of diving and ROV equipment, including but not limited to:
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Dive Hats
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Compressors
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Hydraulic Power Units
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Air Nitrox Dive Systems
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Dive Panels
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Launch and Recovery Systems
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Umbilicals
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- ROV units and topside equipment
  • Complete all required certification paperwork for equipment maintenance activities in accordance with Religen record keeping requirements, including entering data into the system
  • Understand and continuously verify IMCA Competency Assessment Scheme requirements when performing maintenance and servicing activities of dive systems and associated equipment
  • Comply with legal requirements and approved HSEQ policies, procedures and instructions

The successful candidate will require:
  • Minimum Australian Diver Accreditation Scheme (ADAS) certified to AS2815.3
  • Kirby Morgan DSI Maintenance & Repair Technician certificate
  • Commercial Diving Medical
  • Senior First Aid Certificate
  • Oxygen Provider Certificate
  • Diver Medical Technician (DMT) certificate (preferred)
  • Master or Coxswain licence to operate a dive support vessel or boat (preferred)
  • VIC Electrical Licence (preferred)
  • Diver's log book with photo identification
  • Construction Industry OHS White Card
  • Maritime Security Identification Card (MSIC)
  • High Risk Work Licence – Forklift, Dogging and/or Rigging
  • Full Australian Work Rights


Neptune strongly encourages indigenous Australians and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this and all other opportunities for employment.
\xa0
To apply for this role, please submit your application by 28 September 2018.
\xa0
No agencies please.

Job description

Longing for a career, not a job, working with a team of people who are dedicated to creating premium quality, scientifically validated natural health products and love making people healthier and happier?


Swisse Wellness could be it!


With over 40 years' experience in the Wellness sector, we are a leading Wellness brand in Australia who currently employee over 300 team members globally. From our vitamins and supplements, to our Infant Milk Formulas and skincare ranges, when you work for Swisse, you are working across multiple wellness categories, full of premium quality products all formulated to help our customers "Celebrate Life Every Day"!


Our people are the reason we succeed. That’s why they’re our first priority. This informs our culture which is grounded in the belief that if we focus on\xa0PEOPLE,\xa0PRINCIPLES\xa0and\xa0PASSION,\xa0then\xa0PROFIT\xa0will naturally follow.


Our team members love the on-site gym, daily meditation class, flexible working hours, provided team lunches, breakfasts and healthy snacks, ‘CLED’ card rewards, global career opportunities and so much more!


Learn more about life at Swisse on our\xa0LinkedIn Page.


THE ROLE:


The Business Technology (BT) Team Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating team activities and managing the finances and budget in conjunction with the Leadership team. The role will be integral in ensuring all invoicing and receipting for the team has been actioned each month, along with other KPI tracking and reporting.\xa0 The BT Team Coordinator will also assist the team with report development, team communication, team planning and functions.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Team planning, organising and coordinating team actions, events and celebrations
  • KPI management and tracking
  • Ongoing budget management and control for the technology team
  • Managing suppliers, reviewing contracts, solving billing challenges and maintaining fantastic working relationships
  • Working with the Finance team to manage daily administration of technology accounts including purchase orders, receipting, invoicing, account reconciliation and internal governance
  • Preparation of report templates and coordinating team meetings across international time zones and teams
  • Administration tasks and documentation

EXPERIENCE\xa0AND SKILLS:


  • Tertiary qualification in related area (Business Administration)
  • Demonstrated track record of financial administration
  • Demonstrated track record of working with various stakeholders or customers
  • Demonstrated track record for providing outstanding service
  • Creative and collaborative
  • Ability and willingness to learn quickly
  • Demonstrated customer service focus
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)\xa0\xa0
  • Ability to work and share knowledge and expertise in a team environment
  • Love organising events and people, with attention to detail and follow up
  • Understanding of operational accounting tasks
  • A genuine love of working with people and helping them to celebrate!
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Second language desirable – French, Italian or Mandarin

Of vital importance is that you will be a solutions-orientated and self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and a passion for making People Healthier and Happier as well as demonstrate Swisse Wellness Team Spirit to "Celebrate Life Every Day!


Does this role sound perfect for you? If so, please 'Apply Now' by submitting your cover letter and CV to the Swisse team.
